#Text=Melukote
#Text=Melukote is a temple and wildlife sanctuary in Mandya , Karnataka , Southern India .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Melukote is a 4,000-year-old town near Mysore city .
#Text=The buildings are simply amazing and the people follow the same 4,000-year-old Brahmin lifestyle even now .
#Text=Eyesores like electricity , motor bikes and mobile telephones have affected this hillock also .
#Text=Talk
#Text=Even though the language that is generally spoken is Kannada , Tamil is also understood and spoken by many , English can also be used as people are well educated .
#Text=Get in
#Text=If you are travelling by public transportation , you have to alight at Jakkanahalli junction and get an autorickshaw for the last seven kilometer trip up the hill .
#Text=Buses are also available every one hour from Jakkanahalli junction .
#Text=By bus
#Text=KSRTC operates buses regularly from Mysore , K.R.Pet and K.R.Nagar to Melukote .
#Text=By car
#Text=Melukote is 51 km from Mysore and It is 131 km from Bangalore .

#Text=From Mysore , You have to go on Mysore-Bangalore Highway and after Srirangapatana , You have to take a diversion on the left and then reach Pandavapura and go straight for another 26 km to reach Melukote .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Upper Melukote can be covered by foot in one hour .
#Text=Autorikshaws charge Rs.50 for dropping you in the upper temple and Rs.150 for wait and return arrangement .
#Text=Lower Melukote is more spacious and filled with many ancient buildings .
#Text=More natural scenery can be enjoyed by walking down the hill for a distance of seven kilometers up to Jakkanahalli junction .
#Text=See
#Text=Cheluvanarayana Swamy Temple , Upper Melukote ( 1 km ) .
#Text=Very beautiful stone structure of unbelievable big area .
#Text=Yoga Narasimha Temple , Old Melukote ( 1 km uphill ) .
#Text=It 's atop the hill .
#Text=You can take a car halfway up and have to climb a few steps to reach it .
#Text=All temples in Melukote are open till 6 PM .
#Text=Do
#Text=The old buildings .
#Text=The old buildings on the hilltop are so numerous that they cannot be counted in one stretch .
#Text=Their beauty is beyond description and enjoying a single hut can take half an hour and their style cannot be captured in your modern camera .
#Text=People here appear to have frozen into a lifestyle that is thousands of years old and their architectural tastes match with their way of life .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Melukote is famous for Puliyogare , A south Indian food made with Rice , Tamarind and Ground nuts .
#Text=You can buy Puliyogare gojju from any Iyengar shop which can be mixed with rice to prepare a quick snack at home .
#Text=Subbanna Mess , Upper Melukote ( 1 km ) .
#Text=Rs.100 for a Rs.50 level lunch .
#Text=You are not allowed to eat in peace as the owner constantly observes you and intervenes giving directions for proper ancient way of eating .
#Text=Annapoorna Mess , Near Yedhushala Bookstall ( 1 km ) .
#Text=Rs.60 for vegetarian lunch on stiched leaves .
#Text=Shree Nidhi Restaurant , KSRTC bus station ( 2 km ) .
#Text=KSRTC Canteen , KSRTC Bus Station ( 1 km from the temple ) .
#Text=Only snacks , cool drinks and juice items are available .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Bagur Yathri Nivas , Upper Melukote ( 1 km ) .
#Text=Roof level ventilators give light and keep away cold winds .
#Text=Simple accommodations .
#Text=₹500 for rooms without bath with only bed and no windows .
#Text=Yadhugiri Guest House , Near Upper Temple ( 1 km ) , ☏ +917676767638 , +91 9900873987 .
#Text=Rs.650 .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Melukote is a safe place with police station and no robbers around .
